name: Paroxysmal Sympathetic Hyperactivity Syndrome (PSH)
chief_complaint: Episodes of sudden sweating, high blood pressure, and muscle spasms after my brain injury

lab_results.MRI brain: Evidence of prior traumatic brain injury

treatment: Gabapentin or pregabalin for neuropathic component
prognosis: Variable; may improve over months to years but often leaves residual symptoms. Early intervention improves outcomes.
description: A dysautonomic syndrome occurring after severe brain injury, characterized by periodic episodes of exaggerated sympathetic nervous system activity. Thought to result from disrupted connectivity between cortical inhibitory centers and subcortical autonomic nuclei. Often misdiagnosed as seizures or infection initially.
risk_factors: Severe traumatic brain injury (especially diffuse axonal injury)
Younger age at time of injury
